She's out in the backyard sleeping... typical.

11.content: You've just left work after a hard day's.... well work and head home thinking about what you'll find Mira doing. Mira was a tiger cub you found a while back she was lost and alone in the middle of the street. It was pouring rain and well after dark. You couldn't just leave her, that'd be cruel... so you took her in. That was four years ago. Now she's grown quite a bit and has matured into an adult tigress. It never occured to you to send her into the wild or to call someone to get her. Originally you were going to take her to a shelter but you grew fond of her. But one day she really surprised you and talked! She was able to speak complete sentences and think for herself with a concience, emotions and anything else you would find a compitent human capable of doing... mentally at least. By now you've reached your house and are unlocking the door. You expect to find Mira in the backyard lounging about or sleeping. But on the other hand there were days when she surprised you.
11.title: Tiger

111.content:
As soon as you open the door she jumps is right there crouching fifteen feet back.

"There you are, right on schedule" Mira says as she give you a toothy grin.

"Oh nuts" You mutter as she leaps at you and you close the door behind you not wanting your neighbors to think a wild tiger mauled you.

Mira lands on top of you and you give a grunt as she pins you to the ground. She then just sits there and stares at you.

"Would you get off of me!" You shout. Mira complies and gets off of you allowing you to stand.

"So how was your day?" Mira asks nonchalantly.

"It was fine right up until I got attacked by a tiger in my own home." You reply "You know, most tigers sleep eighteen hours a day."

"True" Mira replies "But most tigers don't talk and probably would've finished what I started."

You nod grimly "Yeah okay I'll give you both of those points." You then walk past Mira and into the kitchen "I'm going to start dinner, you be a good girl and stay out of trouble.

"Okay" She says and then trots off into the living room where she curls up and goes to sleep. It's another two hours before the sun sets and you finished dinner within that time.
111.title: She's waiting right behind the door and pou...

1111.content:
You set your food on the table and you set the pile of porkchops on the kitchen floor on a dish for Mira. "Mira! Dinner!" You call. Mira's head shoots up and she rockets toward the dish on the ground before tearing into it..

         You sit down and begin eating your own food as you try to ignore the sounds of the nature documentary taking place in your kitchen. A few seconds later you notice that it's suspicously quiet. "Do I really want to turn around?" You wondered as you twisted in your chair to look over at Mira who was laying in front of an empty bowl of porkchops. She then belches and eyes your plate.

         "You gonna eat that?" She asks.

         "Uh uh.... I know what your thinking and it's not happening."

         "Oh come on please?" She begged.

         "Forget it, you had your dinner and this is mine" You stated firmly "If you it then you can have it over my dead body."

         Mira then gets a devious smirk "Right... dead body like your going to intimidate me" She said as she walked over and pushed you out of your seat with a single forepaw and proceeded to gobble down your food like it was going out of style. "Much better... I'm content. See ya in the morning" She said before padding off to bed.

         "Overgrown house cat...." You mumble under your breath "Next time I'll put some sedative in her food."

         "If you do then I'll chew up your new phone" Mira called as she curled up in bed.

         "Ugh... I'm going to bed good night Mira" You say feeling defeated.

         "Goodnight... I'll see you in the morning. Oh and I promise I wont eat breakfast."
1111.title: You and Mira eat

choices: Nope! Looks like its going to be an early brunch!
Yep! Looks like you can trust her near your food....
11111.content:
You wake up the next morning and stretch a bit before getting out of bed. You leave you're bedroom in your night clothes. But before you go into the living room you check to see if Mira is still asleep. You find her sleeping on her belly with a slight smile on her muzzle. Seeing that she was asleep you began tiptoeing to the kitchen as quietly as you can. "So far so good" you whispered to yourself as you reached the midway point which was also where Mira was sleeping.

         "What are you doing?" Mira asked keeping her eyes closed and without even moving. If you didn't know any better you'd think someone else was in the house. Mira then continues "I told you I wouldn't eat you're breakfast."

         "you also said that you wouldn't try to eat the neighbor's dog ever again two days before I had to have you cough it up. And on top of that I had to make up a story to cover why it was covered in saliva and traumatized!"

         "You would've never known if I hadn't had the leash hanging out of my mouth and besides, you hate that little yap box too."

         "True on both counts, but not the point" you retort as you crossed your arms.

         At length Mira sighs and admits defeat before promising to eat her breakfast and to leave yours alone.... But did she?
11111.title: In the morning

111112.content:
20 minutes later...

"So, um, what're you gonna do today?" Mira asked, licking her plate clean.

"Work, and stuff. I have a job, just putting that out there." You respond. You notice Mira sigh as you put your bowl in the sink.

"Oh, come on, you always have that same response! How do I know you're not playing with squeaky toys when you're at this job thing?" Mira chided. She obviously still doesn't get the idea of having a house, or having to pay for things

"Well, first, all you do is wander around the house and the backyard all day!" You say, slightly annoyed. "And second, if I were playing with squeaky toys, we would not be in this place, we'd be in the forest." You finished. Man, that almost came out kind of harsh, you mentally make a note to slap yourself later. But, she'll probably just get back at you by wrecking the, already torn-up, backyard again.

"Sheesh, sorry. Didn't know it was such a big deal." She retorted, looking at her plate. She looked up to see your legs in front of her, bending down to pick up her plate. You walk over to the kitchen and place the dish in the sink.

"Yah, I'm sorry too, I didn't mean to sound angry at you." You spoke, calmly. You immediately started to feel your throat burning, and your eyes started getting heavy. You notice this but it has no effort over you. "One moment, Mira."

You walk to and climb up the stairs. Making a sharp right, you held out your hand pre-emptively to turn the knob on the door. You swing the door open with a slight feeling of a headache. The mirror was right in front of you for simpler access.
Your face was red, like, you got burned by fire red. Your legs start to slowly give way, you shove your hands onto the quartz counter, the sink in the middle. You feel the brisk coldness of the counter hitting your fingers and forming condensation under and around your hands. Using the sink to support you, you raise one of your hands, this was red too. The headache you felt earlier was now a pulse of pain.

You groan, louder than expected, this made your raw throat hurt like hell. Mira perks her ears up and hears some noise coming from upstairs. *caugh, caugh, .. sniffle* ..... *slip*....... *thud*.
111112.title: Well, you can trust her!

choices: "Call the police to come and collect the scum from downstairs"
"Take the cake out of the oven"
"Get you dinner and see what's on T.V."
1112.content:
Just as you finish dinner however two thieves break your kitchen window and draw knives. This was very unfortunate... for them. "Give us your wallet, your keys and your pin numbers" one of the thieves demanded.

         "Okay, okay!" You cry out "I'll do whatever you want just please don't... don't..." you couldn't finish your sentence because you broke into a fit of laughter. The two thieves looked at each other in confusion. You then straighten up and wipe a tear from you eye. "I'm sorry, I can't do this... It's not that I'm not taking you seriously it's just... well actually that's exactly what it is."

         "Do you think this is a joke?!" One of the men shouted.

         "Yep, and the joke's on you." You reply "you guys picked the wrong house to rob." Just then Mira pounces from behind you and bounds over your head landing on the man closest to you. Although he was wearing a mask you could practically see the fear on his face.

         "Get it off me! GET IT OFF" he cried as Mira shredded his clothes and gave him a few minor scratches before clamping her jaws down on his leg and dragging him downstairs and into the darkness of the basement. "Help me! Don't let it take me!" The man cried while his partner just sat there shaking.

         "Mira!" You call down "Don't put that in your mouth! You don't know where he's been!"

         Suddenly all of the noise stops and a pair of green eyes pierce through the darkness to stare at the thief cowering against the wall. Mira's body then comes into sight and she stops just in front of the visibly shaken man and utters two words "You're next".

         This was the breaking point for that poor man "Keep away from me you... you demon! I've gotta get out of here!" He then runs away screaming into the night.

         Mira then walks up beside you as you watch him run away "Did you enjoy the show?" She asks.

         "Who says that a dog is man's best friend?" You ask as you pet her "You beat a normal pet any day. Well now that that's over, I should probably..."
1112.title: Two burglars break in

choices: you prepare it for something later
11122.content:
"Oh, okay then." Mira says. Turning away, she heads over to the living room couch. She then pounces onto the couch and waits patiently for you.

Those robbers shouldn't have thought about coming to your house to mess with you. Especially when you have Mira around to help out when things become troublesome. Maybe later after talking to the cops about the predicament of having the robbers bust in to your house, you might stop by the store and pick up something for her to eat or play with.

You look at the time and realize that you are just in time to get the cake. Gleeful over how the day turned out you walk over to get the food. Standing before the oven, you grab a pair of oven mitts and open the oven. Carefully, you take out the cake, making sure to not burn yourself or let it fall. You worked hard on the food you are holding.

Placing it on the counter, you can't help but smile at your own good effort. The cake is fine and perfect. It looks good enough to eat.

So then...

113.content:
As you open your front door you find that the lights are off and the curtains are closed dimming the sunlight coming in through the windows."Why do I get the feeling that I just walked into a horror movie?" You asked. A moment later your front door slammed shut behind you.

         "Because you just did" a feminine voice chuckled behind you.

         You felt something brush behind you and you spun around finding nothing, but then again Mira was a tiger and being stealthy is kind of what she specializes in. "You know a simple 'hi how was your day?' would suffice. You said in the direction you thought she might be in.

         "But if I did that then I wouldn't get to play my games" She countered.

         "Sure you could, they'd just be normal games like chess and go fish" you replied as you heard movement to your left.

         "Mmmm.... tempting but I like this better, and besides.... if I didn't play my game then I wouldn't get to see the nervous look on your face." Mira decides she's said enough and suddenly stops talking. You knew that this meant she would be pouncing very soon and you wouldn't be able to see it coming even if you were looking right at her you wouldn't be able to see her. However, trial and error does yield benefits and in this case the benefits were experience. You learned that while you couldn't hear or see Mira, you could still feel her. She may be a tiger but she's your not in the jungle. That being said, the fact that she weighs much more than you means that you can feel her footsteps. The only flaw with that is she has to be right on top of you to feel her footsteps. You hear purring coming from behind you and you feel vibrations on the floor. You quickly dive forward and hear Mira land behind you where you where standing moments ago. "Oh you've gotten better since the last time we played."

         "That was last week! How can you possibly tell that I've gotten better?!"

         "I can't, I was just fooling you into giving away your position. Couldn't see or hear you from behind the couch."

         You yelp as you roll from your current position to the side and Mira silently descends upon where you were. You can see the out line of her body as she turns her head towards you and her green eyes gleam at you. She jumps at you and you dive under her narrowly avoiding her grasp. This continues for a while and it progressivly escalates. Even your neighbors have taken notice.

         Outside of your house your neighbor and his wife are walking by when they hear the noise generated by your game. "Wow... I know that (your name) was talking about dating but that doesn't sound like a date, it sounds like Mr. and Mrs. Smith with all of the action and none of the comedy." He and his wife then decided to knock on your door to see if you were 'okay'. "Hey there neighbor, everything alright?"

         "Yep just dandy!" You call out quickly.

         "Just trying to make sure your date isn't trying to 'kill' ya or anything." He says with a chuckle.

         "Actually I'm not dating I just adopted a pet and we're still laying down the ground rules... whoa jeez! *glass shatters* "Aww, I really liked that mirror!"

         "What did you adopt anyway? A tasmanian tiger?" His wife asked.

         "Close, but wrong continent" you mumble.

         "I'm sorry? I couldn't hear you."

         "Nothing, I've got to go talk to you guys later" you reply through the chaos as you dodge another pounce. "Hey, I'm actually doing pretty good I may actually out last her this time"

1132.content:
Well as it turns out, tigers DO have stripes and Mira DID catch you. Just as you thought you were actually going to win this round, Mira completely took you off guard by using her tail like a snare trap and pulling you off of your feet. You landed on the ground with a grunt of discomfort. When you open your eyes you find yourself staring into Mira's maw. She starts to growl menacingly and moves her sharp teeth closer to your face... just before she starts playfully licking you and purring.

         "Blech! Gross!" You laugh "Get off of me Mira!"

         "I can't do that, you haven't admitted defeat yet" She states before she continued her onslaught.

         "Fine, fine you win already now get off!" You exclaim as you try to push her off of you.

         "Mmm.... not good enough" She replies.

         "What do you mean not good enough!?"

         "Who's the owner here?" She asks.

         "Not you" You laugh.

         "I'm sorry, I couldn't quite hear you."

         "You do realize that only one of us has oppose-able thumbs and the pantry has a door on it" you point out. Mira's face fell upon hearing this and you took full advantage of thhe moment "So.... who's the owner?"

         "Alright, you win this time" Mira laughs as she lets you up "But all of that jumping around and chasing you really took it out of me, I think I'm going to lay down for an hour."

         "You mean five...." You snicker "You're pretty lazy for a tiger, you know that?"

         "You'd better watch it or the next time I pounce on you you'll be my bed cushion for an hour" Mira warned.

         "Oh how I quiver..." you replied with mock fear.

         "I'm warning you-"

         "Then come do something about it" You taunted.

         "I will! When I wake up tomorrow" She said as she laid down in her bed.

         "I rest my case" you chuckled.
1132.title: HA! right, and tigers don't have stripes

121.content:
After a couple of hours roaming around the park and relaxing in the breezy summer air Misty decides she's had enough outdoor activity for now and decides that she's ready to go home. She comes over to you and tugs on the leash you have in your hand. "Ready to go?" you ask as you look down at her but because she's so big you don't have to look that far down. She nods and allows you to hook her leash on her. You then begin the trek home.

         "It's pretty dead out tonight...." Misty comments as you walk home down the seemingly abandon streets.

         "Well, it is a sunday which means alot of kids and adults have work and school in the morning"

         "That's true" she replied as she nodded. She then suddenly stops and looks around "Do you smell that?"

         "No, and neither do you because everytime you smell something it either means trouble for me, trouble for my wallet or both." Ignoring you Misty begins to follow her nose and drags you along for the ride. "Come on Misty I'm in charge here and I say we're going home" you grunted as you pulled and tugged on the leash only managing to slow her down a little.

         "Pfft... you may be holding the leash but it's obvious who's in charge right now" Misty retorted as she laughed. Eventually you realized that this was a losing battle from the start and you had no hope of winning against your wolf.

         "Fine" You sighed. "I guess we can go check it out".

         Misty turned around and grinned at you "That's the spirit" she said cheerily as you stopped fighting her and started following her. "It has right around the corner..." She mused as she came to an intersection. You turn the corner and find...
121.title: Misty

1211.content:
"Why am I not surprised?" You ask as you look down           at Misty.

         "Can we go in and look?" She asks.

         "No, because those are the famous last words of people who don't want to buy anything!" You reply. "If we go in and 'look' then I'll end up buying overpriced meat bricks for you, and that's not happening."

         Misty won't let it go though and continues to beg you for a look inside. Eventually you cave in due to the fact that you couldn't take it anymore and that she wasn't going to let you hear the end of it for the rest of the day. Besides, she only wanted to look.... Right?
1211.title: A butcher's shop (Goodbye paycheck)

12112.content:
Truthfully you expecting and hoping that the owner would turn you away because of Misty. Unfortunately that's not what happened. Rather than shooing you away the owner actually invited you to come in. Apparently, some of his best customers buy his meat for their dogs... Go figure.

         You go in and look at what he's got and Misty drooled, panted and wagged her tail the whole time. Eventually you decided it was time to go. "Come on misty, lets go" you say as you turn to walk out of the door. On your way out though, Misty stops. You turn around to see what she stopped for And to your horror she's staring at an expensive slab of meat. She turns to you and looks at you with big and sad puppy dog eyes and starts whimpering. "No Misty, I'm not buying it" you say firmly. She continues to whimper and whine with those puppy dog eyes fixated on you. "Give it up already, I'm not changing my mind."

         An hour passes, you're on your way home and Misty is trotting behind you with a big packaged slab of meat. "I can't believe I bought that for you" you tell Misty as you walk home. She simply smiles and runs her head against you prompting you to smile. "We'll at least you're happy, but it looks like well be going without cable this month."

"Thanks for the compliment then." You tell her. You loom over her, scouting out for a possible slice. She doesn't mind you at all as she bites down on the crust of two separate pizza slices. "It's sliced, you know." You complain. You bend down to grab a slice but you forgot a plate.

"Pizza is pizza. I like pizza." Veera mumbles through her food. You head to the kitchen to grab a plate, a paper one. There's a distinct feeling you always have in the back of your head that maybe your bud shouldn't eat so much human food, that maybe you're being too generous with human food...

"Nah." You whisper to yourself. You turn the corner to the living room to find Veera has scattered some slices across the floor in front of her laying posture. You grunt. "Who's gonna clean that? Veera!" You scold the fox. She pauses for a moment in thought, her tail stops, then she points to you with a paw, continuing on her meal. With a sigh, you head over to grab whatever you can that's still inside the box. You're hungry too, that darn fox is gonna eat almost the whole pizza! You successfully take three slices before she chokes them down.

------

Later that night, you had finished your slices. Veera had, quite literally, eaten three-fourths of the pizza. Nine slices. She even licked the grease on the inside of the box, who even does that? (Foxes do, of course!) You cleaned up the mess and were sitting on the couch. It was a simple couch, like most. In front of you, the t.v. was tuned in to a random show of Veera's choosing. It was her turn that night to have control of the t.v.. You question a fox's ability to watch t.v. and actually like it, but Veera seems to be able to, and you also don't get why you even share the t.v. with a fox?

The true answer is that you care for Veera. She lay atop your body, watching the t.v., you had decided to stretch out but she wanted to sit there too. So without asking, she hopped up and got comfortable. You're in a deadly serious situation, as you don't want to make her uncomfortable... because she looks so cute!

"Oh come on!" Veera suddenly squeaks in protest to the t.v.. (Yes, foxes squeak.) She sits up whilst on your stomach. "Even I could do that! Now you're out ya dummy." She pushes a paw into the surface below her in protest. With a surprised flex, she realizes that she was accidentally pushing into your gut. She winces, "Sorry." She apologizes.

"Oh, it's okay..." You smile playfully. You grab her in a big hug. "Aha! Gotchya!" You exclaim, the two of you are laughing as you wrestle on the relatively small couch. She yips and bounces on the back and kicks off the floor a couple times. After a moment, you're both tired, hair out of place and crazy. She shakes as you get up. You make a quick move to fix your hair. (Whatever it looks like I guess...? Let's not debate.) "Good night, Veera." You tell her.

"Aww, good night. Guess I'll be watching this show by myself." She trails off. You give a small hand gesture as an apology. You head upstairs and to your room, making sure of getting a good night's rest for the weekend. Tomorrow is Saturday.

------

As you arise, you find for once that Veera is not on the bed near your feet. The sun shines into your room. While getting up, you check the time. It's pretty early. You stretch and head out the door.

You hear sickly moaning from somewhere in the house. You stand at the top of the stairs wondering what, until you recognize the familiar voice of your fox. You rush down the stairs in your pajamas. (Whatever they look like I guess.) You glance through the living room and see Veera laying on the floor. You immediately realize that maybe you let her have too much pizza. You head to her and kneel.

"Ohh... you're finally awake... ughhh." Veera whines. You shake your head. You should've kept an eye on her.

"I think you're sick." You point out dumbly. She nods. You feel deep regret. "Well, Veera, we can do two things. Lay off the pizza or go to the vet." You explain. She doesn't like either option.

"Does the pizza hospital have a vet?" She mumbles. She's not thinking clearly. Maybe this is worse than you think. You decide.

Heck while we're at it let's say that it comes home with you to live with you and then you take care of it and it protects you. The odds of that happening and you winding up with a pet dragon that can fly blow fire and ultimately make life better are.... you know what now I'm curious lets just roll with it and see what happens.
154111111.title: Yup, you sure do lets go find it....

15411112.content:
You decide that looking for something that made three grown men armed with machine guns turn tail and run was probably not a good idea.... at least, not at night anyway. Seeing as how you where nearly killed once tonight, you figure its best to pack it in and head home, you really don't want to see if you can survive another attempt on your life. On that note you jump into your truck and drive home, all the while trying to figure out what happened, who or what intervened and why. Everytime you answered one question another arose. After a while you found it pointless to dwell on it and decided to just head home. You reached your house and went inside and locked the door, you also closed all of the window shutters and readied the escape door that was in your basement for good measure. If the raiders returned, you wanted to be sure you had a way out. Along that same line of thinking you also reloaded your gun.

         After a few more hours you had your house ready to withstand and assualt if it came to that. "That should do it.... now to get some shuteye" You said with a yawn as you climbed the stairs that led to the second floor of your house. You went into your bathroom and washed your face. As you did so you heard a knock at your door. Hearing this you froze and drew your gun. You carefully went downstairs where there was yet another knock. At first you thought it was the raiders, but then you second guessed yourself. "Raiders are direct and always come right out with their attacks...." but then again maybe they're trying to deceive you. Since you weren't sure you decided it was better to be safe than sorry. You walked over to your couch and crouched behind it. "Whose there?" You asked.

         "I don't mean you any harm, my name is....
15411112.title: What are you nuts!? I'm going home!

choices: Come right out and ask her what she's hiding
Trust her, she seems sincere talk to her face to face.
154111121.content:
"...Cindy" Came the reply from outside.

         "Cindy? Pardon me for asking but who are you?"

         "I'm... a neighbor" She replies.

         You begin to get a little suspicious seeing as since the day you moved here you had never once seen or heard of any neighbors living in the forest before. "Really, how come you never stopped by before then?" You ask.

         "Truthfully, it's because I have trust issues and tend to isolate myself. On top of that there's the raiders that live out here... they've caused me quite a few... issues."

         After a while you began to realize that she wasn't in league with the raiders and she might well have been one of your neighbors. However, at the same time you knew that something seemed a bit... off.
154111121.title: Cindy

choices: "Hello" (Try to be polite, don't tick off the dragon that saved you)
"Help!" (Really? A little late for that don't you think?)
1541111212.content:
"She sounds honest enough" you think to yourself. You reason and debate on it a little more and decide that you can trust her and your curiosity was starting to get to you anyway. You put your gun in it's holster and walk over to the door. Quickly but quietly you remove the locks from the door. Once you have done that you slowly open the door towards you and crack it open. However before you can get the door open all the way a white and green blur bursts through the door, closes it and pins you against the wall behind you in one swift motion. When the world around you stopped moving you refocused your eyes on what was holding you against the wall. What you saw rendered you speechless. A dragon approximately seven feet tall and nine feet long had pinned you against the wall. It had a green underbelly and white scales. The skin on its wings was green while the leading edges and veins that lined the wings. Currently you where pinned to the wall by one of the dragon's powerful talons which was attached by an equally powerful foreleg.

         At this point the you've regained your wits and your mind has caught up to what's happened. The only question now is what are you gonna say? Because it's obvious that you can't do anything.
1541111212.title: Trust her, she seems sincere talk to her face t...

15411112122.content:
You start to draw in breath to call for help... of course this was just a reflex because had you been thinking you would have realized that nobody would have heard you. As you open your mouth however the dragon moves one of its talons to cover your mouth.

         "Shhh, be quiet... I'm not going to harm you" It or rather she said in a calm voice that matched the one you'd heard outside.

         You begin to calm down and relax, but every now and again you squirm a bit. But that was more out of the fact that you were pinned against a wall rather than fear. After a little bit you calm down enough to think rationally and ask the one question you can think of, even though it's a dumb one. "Who and what are you?"

         "Everything I've told you about myself is true... well minus my name as I don't actually have one..." She replied "As to what I am, I think that it's rather obvious.

         "So... You really are a talking dragon?"

         "Are you a breathing human?" She countered.

         "Okay, point taken. Now my next question is why did you save me?"

         "Those men would've killed you. I just happened to be in the area and on top of that you were an innocent person who was in danger... I couldn't just stand by and let you die, plus those guys have been running around my cave and stashing a lot of their stuff in the front of it and they make a lot of noise when I'm trying to sleep. So thrashing them was a pleasure anyway." She admitted.

         "So if that was the case, then why'd you run away?" You ask.

         "I wasn't sure if I was ready to actually talk with a human without disguising myself... In the past I've tried to make contact with humans before and they all either ran away from me or attacked me."

         "Is that why you rushed me as soon as I opened the door?"

         "Partially... But it was also because I didn't want you to draw attention from the raiders"

         You nod and tilt your head in though, "Okay, that makes since I guess.... could you let me down now?" You ask as she still has you pinned against the wall.

         She tilts her head in thought and then sighs quietly, "Only if you promise me you won't run."
15411112122.title: "Help!" (Really? A little late for that...

154111121221.content:
You inwardly sigh, you really don't have any guarantee that she won't attack you if you let your guard down. But, by the same token you wouldn't be around to mentally debate the issue had she not saved you earlier that night. After a while you decide that promising her that you wouldn't scream and abiding by the promise.

         "Okay, I... Promise" You reply. Seeing this the dragon smiled gently at you and let you down carefully. After your feet were on the ground and she released you from her grasp she sat motionless for a while watching your every move. This made you very self conscious and rather nervous as well. "Um, is something wrong?" You asked worried that she might say something like 'just sizing up my dinner' or 'I'm trying to remember what you look like before you become a bulge in my stomach'. But much to your surprise she said something else.

         "I'm sorry, It's just that you're the first human who hasn't run away from me... I'm not used to that..."

         You then feel pity upon poor dragon as she looks at you with sadness in her eyes. However this sadness is also accompanied by joy. You decide that this is an appropriate time to thank her for saving your life. "I never properly thanked you for saving me... so thank you."

         "I said it was something I wanted to do anyway earlier and that helping you was a bonus... However, I'm very glad that I was able to save you." You quietly nod in response, you didn't feel you could say much to that. She then asked a question that you didn't expect. "Are you... Afraid of me?"

         You look at the ground and sigh in shame. "I guess I am." This caused her to droop her head and turn away from you. "But" You add causing her to turn and look at you "I would love to get to know you better so I won't be..."

         She then turned towards you with hopeful eyes. "Do you Really mean that?" She asked.

         "I do" You solemnly reply.

         "If you really mean that then I'd like..."
154111121221.title: "I promise..."

1541111212212.content:
"You want to what?" You ask

         "I want to live here with you..." She repeated. "I promise I won't be a burden, and I'll help you out in any way I can." You blink at her proposal, however before you are able to reply to her she continues to speak "Also, I would like to stay so that I can look after you... I know I haven't known you that long but I really don't want anything to happen to you. The best way for me to look after you is for me to be right here with you."

         "You do realize that what your suggesting is very similar to the life of a pet, right?"

         "I don't care nor do I mind... the life I'm suggesting is much, much better than the life of loneliness that I'm living now." She then looked at you very seriously "Please... Let me stay I'm begging you, your the first and only person who's actually cared enough to talk to me. I don't want that to go away..." By the time she finished speaking she was nearly in tears. The question is, what will you do.
1541111212212.title: "To live here with you"

15411112122121.content:
In good conscience you couldn't send her back to a life of loneliness and solitude and she seemed pretty sure that this was what she wanted... So you told her that she could stay.

         She was overjoyed at your response, If you had time to cringe you would've. As soon as you gave her your answer she pounced on you and pinned you down to the floor while nuzzling you. All the while, she never stopped thanking you. Eventually she let you up.

         "Well it's late and it's time for bed..." You say as you glance at the clock. "I'll be right back" You go to your linen closet and grab a bed spread and lay it out on the floor.

         "What are you doing?" She asks, "Don't you have a bed?".

         "I do, but I imagine that sleeping in that cave every night alone can be depressing. I thought it would be nice for you if you had someone here beside you... tomorrow I'll move my bed down here. That way you never have to be alone when you sleep ever again" You say as you climb into bed "Oh, and I think I have a name for you, how about Aeriss?"

         "You're so kind..." She says... she then stops for a moment to think about the name you've offered her. "Aeriss?" She asks wondering listening to how the name sounded as she said it..."I like that name, I'll take it." With that both of you happily fell asleep in each other's company
15411112122121.title: Let her stay

154111121221212.content:
Being what it was, it felt weird to sleep with a creature the world did not know existed. More like, pet, if you think about it.

Suddenly, you found yourself awake, there was a noise at the back exit to your kitchen. Getting up, you try not to wake the dragon. I guess you can call her many things, dragon, pet, savior, friend? Many. Anyway, you grab your pistol, it was sitting on the counter. You know that there must have been a disturbance in the force for you to have woken up. (You're a heavy sleeper.) Putting your weapon in holster, you make a silent dash towards the kitchen. You stop at the doorway and peer around the corner. Those raiders were there again, man, that is annoying. You silently make a run to your stairs, passing Aeriss, and you grab the support beam and start moving upstairs. You head over the the room that had a window with a view to the outdoors next to the kitchen. There were more than three raiders this time, there were about 10. Putting your palm against your head and quickly running your hand through your hair, you start to get nervous about the situation, and now you realize you have to get yourself and Aeriss out of this situation. You beam through the doorway and back down the stairs, running over to the sleeping dragon.

"Aeriss! We gotta get outta here!" You rush quickly, there was a shaky edge to your words. She did not wake.

"AERISS!!" You shout, shaking her shoulder. She blasted to her feet and glanced around the room. She was more keen on her senses, considering her appearance. She already knew that this was trouble, by the way she heard your voice.

"What's going on?" Aeriss replied, groggily yet with a sharp tone. You gesture to the kitchen as you see flashing lights blasting off every surface. The automatic lights flashed on. Aeriss glanced over to the source, her expression was surprised.

"That's what's going on! We have to get out of here!" You shout. You hear a sharply put noise in the kitchen, the window broke. There was a clink following this, and a faint roll. Your face turned pale, there was a grenade in the hallway.

"Watch out!" Yelled a voice from the outside. Aeriss grabbed you with a sudden jerk and hit her shoulder against the wall, the wall broke down and there was a hole in it. The grenade went off and you heard a sharp noise that pierced your ears. The explosion was placed perfectly to the point where you saw a huge explosion. This was just a grenade, how did a huge explosion like that go off?! You remember as you have had a gas stove. You had a big view of the explosion. Wait, how? You looked down and saw that you were flying!

"Woah! Oh my god!" You shriek as you were being carried by Aeriss. She looked down at you, she looked as if she was sorry. (She didn't know if humans were accustomed to flying, because she's seen airplanes before.)

Ten minutes later, Aeriss lands at your spot. She lets you down and sits next to you. Both of you were traumatized, you especially, you loved that house and you weren't planning on moving again.

"What was that?" Aeriss asked, she obviously does not know what a grenade is, but she knows that was no fire. You get ready to respond.
154111121221212.title: late that night

choices: I think I have an idea... (Reader's Choice)
1541111212212122.content:
You open your mouth to speak, but you simply can't think of anything to say. Your house just exploded-- and you are with a dragon-- and there are people who tried to kill you... and you also flew--

"Hey, are you alright?" Aeriss asked. You look into Aeriss's eyes with an expression of pure confusion. You shake your head and look away, staring blankly into the forest. Aeriss turns her head to see what you're looking at. She look back at you. You drop down and sit there, at your spot and brush your hand against your head.

"Hey--" Aeriss spoke again, trying to get your attention. She gets closer and sits down next to you. "I don't know what to say either." Aeriss admits.

"Well, I don't know what to do now. My forever home is utterly destroyed." You sigh.
1541111212212122.title: Speechless

info.brief_description: You are living on your own and find adopt an amazing animal who changes your life.
info.description:
Okay lets cover the ground rules shall we?

1. No one liner or super short chapters, if your going to write then write.

2. Let's keep this pg 13 okay?

3. No swearing, obscene language or dirty jokes.

4. Use proper grammar, I'm not asking for perfection but I don't want to see a chapter that looks like someone half sleep wrote it with a six year old's help.

5. Write the story in first person. Remember YOU are the main character.

6. And finally no throwing in completely random chapters. I don't want to see "And as he opened the fridge he pulled out a machine gun and ran outside punching the hulk in the face." I hate crud like that.

Okay... those are the rules and just as a small side note you should know that I CAN and WILL DELETE if you break these rules. And on that note I'll get out of the way and let you write! Have fun!
